Title: None
Description:
IPS Job Opportunity – IT Cybersecurity Specialist
Posting Date: 10 August 2021
Job Number: 2096
Location: Panama City Beach, FL
Hours: Typically M–F 0730–1600; hours may vary depending upon requirements
Security Clearance Type: Active Secret Preferred; Eligible for Secret Acceptable
U.S. Citizenship Required: Yes
Employment Status: Regular, Full-Time
Position Summary, Cybersecurity Specialist
Innovative Professional Solutions, Inc. (IPS) is a small, woman-owned defense contractor and has enjoyed the privilege of providing excellent support to our Naval Surface Warfare Center Panama City Division (NSWC PCD) customers for nearly 20 years. We are looking for a highly qualified, highly skilled Information Technology (IT) Cybersecurity Specialist with experience working in the Department of Defense (DoD). The IT Cybersecurity Specialist will become a member of the Naval Surface Warfare Center Panama City Division (NSWC PCD) Cyberspace Information Technology/Cybersecurity Workforce (CIT/CSWF). As such, this person is instrumental in: assisting with technology vulnerability identification and remediation; preparing, updating, and maintaining Risk Management Framework (RMF) documentation, including Authority to Operate (ATO) packages, within in the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) tool; and performing security technical implementation guide (STIG) and information assurance vulnerability management (IAVM) monitoring and implementation. This position requires a DoD Secret security clearance, which requires U.S. citizenship.
Highlights of Responsibilities:
Perform system and software checks to ensure ongoing compliance with software development related cybersecurity guidelines.
Develop Memorandum for the Record for new software versions.
Perform assured compliance assessment solution (ACAS) scanning.
Perform security technical implementation guide (STIG) and information assurance vulnerability management (IAVM) monitoring and implementation.
Provide Vulnerability Remediation Asset Manager (VRAM) reporting.
Provide updates to the software accreditation Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) records as guidance changes and is implemented within the program.
Monitor primary software, as well as project supporting software, Department of the Navy Applications and Database Management System (DADMS) records for expiration dates; provide documentation to request extension or updates as appropriate.
Implement updates to RMF cybersecurity plans and other planning documents.
Perform cybersecurity Plan of Action and Milestone (POA&M) generation and maintenance.
Assist in the execution of plans for incident responses.
Perform ad-hoc patch or system/software vulnerability remediation testing and application in support of cybersecurity-related data calls.
Maintain required certifications and training.
Requirements:
Prior experience with cybersecurity for DoD information systems and preferably with U.S. Navy information systems.
Knowledge of a full range of cybersecurity principles including systems software, database software, and immediate access storage technology.
Knowledge of a broad range of concepts and principles to assess and advise on vulnerability to attack from a variety of sources.
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field. Prior related military service or 6 years of relative work experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
2-3 years of experience in Cybersecurity services including information security.
Broad technology expertise with application, system integration, data, and/or infrastructure knowledge.
Familiarity with: o ACAS Nessus Vulnerability scanner o Linux operating systems o Windows and/or Linux system administration o McAfee HBSS Server
Required Education, Experience, and Certifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Communications, or related.
Current CompTIA or Microsoft security certificate.
Travel:
No travel is currently anticipated for this position.
Tools and Technology:
Government-owned and COTS web-based tools.
Working Conditions/Environment:
Work will be conducted at an IPS office as well as at NSWC PCD. Although this is not a telework position, there may be times teleworking is required due to COVID-19 protocols.
IPS is a Federal Contractor, and an equal opportunity employer, and gives fair consideration to all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or marital status.
IPS is a drug-free employer.
Proof of citizenship or immigration status will be required upon employment at IPS.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $30.00 per hour
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Cybersecurity: 2 years (Preferred)
Work Location: One location

Title: Senior Information Assurance/Security Specialist
Description:
The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. With a wealth of learning and career development opportunities, a world-class training facility and leading market tools, we make sure our people continue to grow both professionally and personally. If you're looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career in Advisory.
KPMG is currently seeking a Lead Specialist to join our Federal Advisory practice.
Responsibilities:
Lead Information Technology (IT) Protection projects involving strategy, implementation, support, and software/hardware optimization related to IT operations, business processes, business resiliency, security, and data integrity
Review security profiles to assess how application security is being used as a part of the overall business process control environment
Facilitate business process design as it relates to managing identities and access privileges such as architecture, delegated administration models, workflow models, and access control models
Understand current regulatory environment and related implications to identify management and security compliance as well as assist with scoping prospective engagements and developing proposals
Present firm-based approaches and messaging at internal training classes, external events, and client meetings
Qualifications:
A minimum of five years of experience in IT Security Knowledge of the IT Protection implementation methodologies; U.S. Federal government consulting experience preferred
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university in an appropriate field
Extensive knowledge base in operations, systems evaluation and architecture
Experience with ServiceNow SecOps preferred
Exceptional interpersonal, team building, mentoring, and leadership skills with a demonstrated ability to gain the confidence and respect of senior level executives
Ability to travel as required to support firm engagements
U.S. citizenship required and an active U.S. Federal government Secret security clearance
KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
